section.name: Communicated with each other and worked together

values.desc: No evidence
Rarely
Sporadically
Frequently

values.name: a
values.desc: All team members communicated ideas related to a common goal

values.name: b
values.desc: Directed each other to tasks/information
Speak up and share your ideas/insights with team members.
Listen to other team members who are sharing their ideas or insights and do not interrupt their communications.
Turn on your camera and microphone so people can see and hear you.
Restate the prompt to make sure everyone is at the same place on the task.
Have all members of the team consider the same task at the same time rather than working independently

section.name: Considered the contributions, strengths and skills of all team members

values.desc: No evidence
Rarely
Sporadically
Frequently

values.name: a
values.desc: Acknowledged statements of other team members

values.name: b
values.desc: Invited other team members to participate in the conversation, particularly if they have not contributed in a while

values.name: c
values.desc: Expanded on statements of other team members

values.name: d
values.desc: Asked follow-up questions to clarify team members' thoughts
Verbally or nonverbally indicate that you heard what another team member said.
Invite other members of the team to share their ideas or explain their reasoning.
Ask for clarification or rephrase statements of other team members to ensure understanding.
Contribute your insights and reasoning if you disagree with another member of the team
Call attention to particularly effective contributions.

section.name: Moved forward towards a common goal

values.desc: No evidence
Minimally
Intermittent
Steadily

values.name: a
values.desc: Stayed on task, attentive to the assignment with only brief interruptions

values.name: b
values.desc: Refocused team members to make more effective progress towards the goal

values.name: c
values.desc: Checked time to monitor progress on task
Minimize distractions and focus on the assignment (close unrelated websites or messaging on phone or computer, turn off music, put away unrelated materials).
Redirect team members to current task.
Ask other team members for their input on a task to move discussion forward.
Ask for assistance if your team is stuck on a task and making little progress.
Compare progress on task to the time remaining on assignment.
Communicate to team members that you need to move on.
As a team, list tasks to be done and agree on the order for these tasks.

section.name: Acted as a cohesive unit that supported and included all team members

values.desc: No evidence
Minimally
Partially
Effectively

values.name: a
values.desc: Acted as a single unit that did not break up into smaller (fragmented) units for the entire task.

values.name: b
values.desc: Worked simultaneously as a single unit on the common goal

values.name: c
values.desc: Openly and respectfully discussed questions and disagreements between team members
Address team members by name.
Welcome members of the team and make sure everyone is ready to work on the task.
Acknowledge contributions verbally and non-verbally.
Encourage all team members to work together on the same tasks at the same time, as needed.
Check that all team members are ready to move on to the next task.
Encourage every team member to contributed toward the goal.
Invite other team members to provide alternative views and reasoning.
Celebrate team successes and persistence through roadblocks.
